edu.nyu.cs.javagit.api.commands
Class GitStatus

java.lang.Object
  edu.nyu.cs.javagit.api.commands.GitStatus

public final class GitStatus
extends java.lang.Object

GitStatus provides an API to status of a git repository.

Method Detail

status

public GitStatusResponse status(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                                GitStatusOptions options,
                                java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                         throws JavaGitException,
                                java.io.IOException
It returns a GitStatusResponse object that contains all the details of the output of <git-status> command.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - Directory pointing to the root of the repository.
options - Options that are passed to <git-status> command.
paths - List of paths or patterns
Returns:
GitStatusResponse object
Throws:
JavaGitException - Exception thrown if the repositoryPath is null or if options or paths are invalid.
java.io.IOException - Exception is thrown if any of the IO operations fail.

status

public GitStatusResponse status(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                                java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                         throws JavaGitException,
                                java.io.IOException
It returns a GitStatusResonse object that contains all the details of the output of <git-status> command. It has no options passed as parameter to the method.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - Directory path to the root of the repository.
paths - List of paths or file patterns.
Returns:
GitStatusResponse object
Throws:
JavaGitException - Exception thrown if the repositoryPath is null or if options or paths are invalid.
java.io.IOException - Exception is thrown if any of the IO operations fail.

status

public GitStatusResponse status(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                                GitStatusOptions options)
                         throws JavaGitException,
                                java.io.IOException
It returns a GitStatusResonse object that contains all the details of the output of <git-status> command. It has no path passed as parameter to the method.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - Directory path to the root of the repository.
options - Options that are passed to <git-status> command.
Returns:
GitStatusResponse object
Throws:
JavaGitException - Exception thrown if the repositoryPath is null or if options or paths are invalid.
java.io.IOException - Exception is thrown if any of the IO operations fail.

status

public GitStatusResponse status(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                                GitStatusOptions options,
                                java.io.File file)
                         throws JavaGitException,
                                java.io.IOException
It returns a GitStatusResonse object that contains all the details of the output of <git-status> command. Instead of passing a list of paths, this method takes a String argument to a file-path.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - Directory path to the root of the repository.
options - Options that are passed to <git-status> command.
file - Filename or directory
Returns:
GitStatusResponse object
Throws:
JavaGitException - Exception thrown if the repositoryPath is null or if options or paths are invalid.
java.io.IOException - Exception is thrown if any of the IO operations fail.

status

public GitStatusResponse status(java.io.File repositoryPath)
                         throws JavaGitException,
                                java.io.IOException
It returns a GitStatusResonse object that contains all the details of the output of <git-status> command. It does not pass any options or file paths. This is the most generic execution of <git-status> command.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - Directory path to the root of the repository.
Returns:
GitStatusResponse object
Throws:
JavaGitException - Exception thrown if the repositoryPath is null or if options or paths are invalid.
java.io.IOException - Exception is thrown if any of the IO operations fail.

statusAll

public GitStatusResponse statusAll(java.io.File repositoryPath)
                            throws JavaGitException,
                                   java.io.IOException
It returns a GitStatusResonse object that contains all the details of the output of <git-status> command. It is equivalent of executing <git-status> command with '-a' option.

Parameters:
repositoryPath - Directory path to the root of the repository.
Returns:
GitStatusResponse object
Throws:
JavaGitException - Exception thrown if the repositoryPath is null or if options or paths are invalid.
java.io.IOException - Exception is thrown if any of the IO operations fail.

getSingleFileStatus

public GitStatusResponse getSingleFileStatus(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                                             java.io.File path)
                                      throws JavaGitException,
                                             java.io.IOException
It returns a GitStatusResonse object that contains all the details of the output of <git-status> command, but filters output for a single file

path -
Returns:
GitStatusResponse object
Throws:
JavaGitException - Exception thrown if the repositoryPath is null
